Posts.Content: Mar 9, 2012 04:46PM penny4cats wrote: My experience is only just that so please don't infer anything for your situation. I was on xeloda 7/10 and by 8/11 couldn't take the ses anymore so onc says go 7/7 instead of 14/7. I was already on a low dose 1500 but man did my cancer take off in the 3 mos I was on the lower dose at 7/7. I did not have an office visit or labs for 3 mos due to a mutual decision with my onc. I was really tired of the every 6 weeks meet and greet. If you opt for 7/7 just insist they give you close f/u. One plus to halaven is I got my hands and feet back so when chemo fatigue isn't bad I can really enjoy my good days and sheets free of bag balm.
Posts.Title: Xeloda - going from 14/7 to 7/7 schedule RobynK penny4cats

Posts.Content: penny4cats wrote: December and January were so hard when we lost so many sisters. This week brought me news of two more of my sisters passing. One I only knew thru this forum but the other I had the honor and priviledge of spending four days with in Wisconsin at a metastatic retreat. When we wear our hearts on our sleeves we open ourselves up to the pain that comes with each loss, but I could not live my life differently.I know we honor them best by shedding our tears and then by continuing to "live" I re-read Little Libby's poem posted on Inspire and I too dig deep to the strength in my roots as another sister has fallen. Thank you for listening. Dx 12/1/2009, ILC, 5cm, Stage IV, Grade 1, 13/17 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: help with grief/loss when loosing another sister penny4cats steelrose

Posts.Content: Sep 17, 2012 08:34PM penny4cats wrote: I lost my Father when I had just turned 21 and my Mother lived a week past my 35th. I  find as my disease progresses I am still a little hung up on the lack of tangible objects that my future DIL will allow. I realize my son and daughter will carry me in their hearts and memories but what I wouldn't give to have a little more of my parents as I approach the end of my life. Yes old favorite photos are out on my desk and a few of my mother's newsy notes where now I appreciate how scarred she was as her cea kept climbing. The art and my writings will be for my son and daughter and future generations to someday discover who I became in the final phase of my life. The objects sources for my kids to tell their kids about the blueberry picking, apples, donuts, glacier, Nantucket. Memories now bring sweet peace and healing. Just because my physical self is gone is no reason to shed everything representative of my spirit. I feel yes maybe the young adults have moved on for now but perhaps decades from now they may wish to know their Mother, to hold what she held, cherished and loved.
Posts.Title: I am so so sad 4myangels penny4cats

Posts.Content: penny4cats wrote: I would like to ask my BCO brothers and sisters to please check out Vanessa and her sisters. Theirs is the most amazing loving living legacy gift. It has been awhile since something touched my heart as sincerely and genuinely as their work. The balance created without any agenda to push other than to speak to the humanity that exists in all of us. I am asking my son and daughter to take the pledge as a final gift to me but really it is for them. I hope their generation and future ones can begin to live their lives sincerely. Dx 12/1/2009, ILC, 5cm, Stage IV, Grade 1, 13/17 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Jan 5, 2012 12:40AM penny4cats wrote: Hi, I have only completed 2 infusions and tomorrow will be cycle 2 if my counts are okay. My hair has thinned alot so I sport a very short pixie cut at the moment; haven't had one in almost 50 years. I am asking to have less decadron. i have never been nauseous just the fatigue, mouth ,throat sore, funny taste buds for a couple of days, increased acid reflux despite the nexium, mild constipation. okay enough of the se's. Just wish I had more days of feeling normal other than the few I get right before the next treatment and it is funny when the bottom of y feet go numb. i am so glad someone else posted their se's so i went gee it's just the se's from the halaven. i am still in favor of starting the traveling halaven tee shirt. our sea sponge mascot. penny
Posts.Title: Halaven - Day 1 PJB Wanderingneedle

Posts.Content: Jan 12, 2012 09:16PM penny4cats wrote: Can't wait to see the tee shirt design. I just had cycle 2 day 8 wbc a little low so neupogen day 9,10,11. I am curious if anyone who gets halaven at dana farber if they are getting steroids or not. i do not get any antinaus with periotoneal mets and missing parts i can't risk obstruction. i asked for 6 mg decadron today so i will see what day 9-11 bring. i just hate  the steroid high and crash at least it is only in the premed. i wish i had the 3600 today cost to have fun instead but there is no price tag on what time i get with my young adult children. maybe i will grow seaweed hair or a new sponge boob. decided i needed to get back in the fountain so will watch stewart and colbert everynight. we all need more laughter. penny sponge boob square?

Posts.Content: Feb 7, 2012 12:40AM penny4cats wrote: Hi, Karen you amaze me. You have such a great outlook. Maybe affinitor and an AI if your onc will push the envelope with the ins. industry. Mine explained the closer to FDA approval the more likely they will cover it. Wish I could come to Texas for a huge steak and to give you a huge hug! Please let us know what your next treatment is. Please feel free to check out thelydiaproject.org or com and sweetsleepministry.org or com. They should both be able to be googled. I am spirtiual not formally religious but as my mother would say if she were alive we need to remember Norman Vincent Peale and the positive power of prayer  ( even if today some might call it meditation).Treatment change is always a roller coaster,here's hoping you get your pinkie back. Smiles and a rainbow headed your way. Penny

Posts.Content: Mar 21, 2012 07:50PM penny4cats wrote: reiki is energy healing and involves practioner who works on you, very little physical touching, table like a comfy massage table, blanket, soothing music. no talking during the session. at cancer camps i have had treatments by reki volunteers and now at my cancer connection i can have a complimentary treatment of complementary care each week. i prefer massage but their are so different, sometimes not being touched is better. some would consider it hocus pocus and i might have a hard time payin 65-75 for an hour out of pocket but it helps to reduce my pain physical and emotional. at open reikki night i had 3 practioners working on me. if you feel nothing i would say that is not the person for you. there are all several levels- i would opt for reiki master. crickets answer for cancer may not cover reiki but they would cover a massage or 2 for you depending on cost.  halle signing in phillie!

Posts.Content: Jan 5, 2012 07:47PM penny4cats wrote: Help! I moved to be nearer to my college students after dancing the mets dance for 2 years already. Time is precious. I interviewed this general hemonc prior to selecting her. I had to go from xeloda and dana farber said halaven now. today was my second cycle day 1. I went thru ses and said i finally felt great the week coming into the new day 1. i said less quality time than xeloda but glad not to have hf anymore. she says to me it doesn't sound like you have much quality of life. this is from a dr who wrote a book about medicare spending too much on a persons last months. i replied politely that only the individual can decide about the quality of her own life and that the week coming into  treatment was pretty okay. yes my q of l is different now but i felt she was putting $ tag on how much it takes to keep us alive as we are terminal. this is a small town and i have scheduled a consult with another older onc next week unfortunately they take call for each other. i was polite but now i am pissed off. who are they to decide what the hugs and time with our children and friends is worth. thanks for listening. Penny

Posts.Content: May 28, 2012 09:05PM penny4cats wrote: i had to go to urgent care today with 2 degree burns on two of my fingers on my bad side ie the one with no lymph nodes. learning to use my left hand for now. hurt like a bugger last night but when i saw blisters today said better go. silver sulfadiazine cream and fat gauze fingers. lol as i have lots of pain meds. tried my marinol finally at my son's and neighbor's insistence. no high just like an ativan feel but slept well. felled by an exploding sweet potato. forget eatinghealthy.. it isn't fun feeling crummy and staying in. i miss being able to be physically active. this disease ages us in fast forward motion. don't color my hair so qualified for senior meal no questions asked. maybe we should start a thread on read/watch this when you feel crummy. the reads on the book lovers list are beyond me most days i do miss my mind. hoping you're feeling better elizabeth. and i enjoyed meeting robin and donese via fb

Posts.Content: Dec 16, 2011 02:28AM penny4cats wrote: day 1 2.25 mg 8 hours ago, waiting for the party to start. is neulasta pretty much a given on day 9.  i will only do nepogen the pain was a lot less for me than the big#####dose at once. told no sudafed or any related products because of the qt elongation with heart also some anitbiotics can cause problems as well  hoping to extent and reach stable at least for a few months to get a quick trip to florida for sunshine and a beach walk with my daughter. the onc has me so frightened that something could change fast so my 19 daughter will be my proxy when my college friend of over 30 years is out of the country. my dental hygenist said no to crest prohealth rinse floss toothpaste due to disrupting the good/bad bacteria if our counts get low. biotene pbf green rinse and toothpaste are my favorites, i have dry mouth from other meds. maybe we should have a traveling halaven shirt like the woman who started the jeans. maybe the shirt could have a facebook page. i do not have a facebook page but now that winterbreak is here. i will guilt my kids into doing it for my birthday. cyeber hugs and smiles, hope your new tx holds you. Posts.Title: Halaven - Day 1 PJB Wanderingneedle

Posts.Content: Jul 14, 2012 05:27AM penny4cats wrote: I finally had my power port installed at the end of April. My first blood draw they could barely get enough blood for a cbc. IR for fibrin clot bust with tpa and the next day blood transfusions. That was in JUne. Two days ago I went and the port has formed another fibrin clot. My onc who felt so bad because she talked me into the port as my veins couldn't take much more. She had to draw my blood peripherally. I am set up for tpa clot bust again with labs and ct scan  the same day. If IR can't access me nobody can. My onc said gemzar can be given carefully as things go in the port easily just the fbrin sheath flaps back down on the withdraw. Other more toxic chemos can't. My question is has this happened to anyone else. And when toxic treatrments are the only ones left  Will I need tpa clot bust each time and then get my chemo. I hate the effing complications. On a positive note the beds are comfortable and each area a single down in the cardiac cath my new home away from home. The quiet dark space is great for meditation which I need to practice more often.

Posts.Title: Halaven - Day 1 PJB Wanderingneedle

Posts.Content: Feb 1, 2012 03:27AM penny4cats wrote: Donese, have you requested materials for caregivers from advanced breast cancer. i think they are listed on the mbcn,org website under wellness community maybe/ i ordered excelllent free of charge materials. i don't know what it is like for our caregivers but nuture yourself. the materials spell things out but in one of the besst manners i've seen. hugs, smiles and it's a new month with hopefully lots of chocolate- hearts, caramel nut turtles no sponges although who remembers the molasses sponge candy covered with chocolate, okay a kind of sponge i could go fot.
Posts.Title: Halaven - Day 1 PJB Wanderingneedle

Posts.Content: Feb 6, 2012 01:58PM penny4cats wrote: Hi, I have finished my third cycle=6 infusions. I do have day 3/4 less energy but feel absolutely human the 1-2 days before day 8. I am so much better on no steroid.The first time cycle 3 day 1 I came home and napped no steroid rage. I do miss the energy but not the crash, pigging out and insomnia. Am I  the only one steroid/antiemetic free. The feet and fingertips are a little numb but minimal pain. I just ignore hobbies that require fine dexterity. I will continue on in my sponge haze as I do not want to think of what tumor markers may show, b ut from how I am feeling I think I will be okay.My onc. dislikes how patients become obsessed and held hostage by the numbers and the ppower they wield over us. She prefers it's about the numbers, symptoms, physical exam and scans all together. I feel like the old show wagon train may we all continue aboard with the mighty sea sponge.
Posts.Title: Halaven - Day 1 PJB Wanderingneedle

Posts.Content: Feb 24, 2012 07:27PM penny4cats wrote: hi, glad to hear about robin and from you elizabeth. i finished cycle 4 yesterday. anyone taking neupogen day 9/10/11 other than me? still adjusting to the perpetual anemia from the chemo. feel like the dainty ladies of past centuries, drink my tea, read, eat chocolates, write in journals, trying to figure out and actually do snapfish books. stilll think we could do a flat sea sponge like flat stanley where the sponge comes to visit and we sign and send to the next person. we lost karen doing our tshirts due to halaven not working for her. i will try to find out what said sponge looks like. crashing on sat/sun. hugs and smiles. what is in bloom down your way? penny
Posts.Title: Halaven - Day 1 PJB Wanderingneedle

Posts.Content: Mar 21, 2012 11:47AM penny4cats wrote: I have completed five cycles of halaven. After day 8 I am more tired andmy muscles scream for more oxygen but i am getting used to it. I don't think blood transfusions are an option unless my crit gets really super low. I hope they adjust your dose or figureout if it is something beside the halaven. I have no steroid or antinausea. I was alot worse when the old onc. forced decadron on me.Eliazabeth will I get to meet you at LBBC next month? Pity party serve a purpose. I started crying during a reiki that my son came with me and we were on adjacent tables holding hands and the energy wasso powerful my tears kept flowing. I could only think about how a mother holds her childs hand and now he is 23 and how I never hold his hand anymore., but could picture down the road and the final touch and letting go. I had to move to a visual of the japanese gardens i have visited. it was really hard to stay with the koi, trees, flowers, rocks, water when my mind kept trying to stray i raked the sand. Does any one here embrace reiki as well? You will feel better soon. It's hard to figure out the cycle but it's like remembering which days you got the worst cramps etc. HUgs and smiles.
Posts.Title: Halaven - Day 1 PJB Wanderingneedle

Posts.Content: Mar 24, 2012 02:23AM penny4cats wrote: Hallo from Halaven five o my # of cycles completed. i do 3 days of neupogen 9-11 so whites stay ok. the hit to my reds and perpetual sob with exertion or feeling like every muscle fiber is screaming for oxygen is not fun, glad i don't mind eating red meat. i think it has to get really low before a transfusion. procrit isn't used anymore is it? saw hunger games with my daughter-loved it-michelle lawrence was the right one cast-especially after i saw her in winter's bone.- any helpful hints on dealing with low reds? my onc has none other than this is the life on constant chemo. tumor markers coming up and she is checking ldh level, i asked why and someting about halaven and kidneys, but hadn't read that anywhere. will have bard power port slim design installed soon. happy halle days except for 2-3 right after infusion.
Posts.Title: Halaven - Day 1 PJB Wanderingneedle

Posts.Content: May 25, 2012 02:01AM penny4cats wrote: i have been on afinitor/aromasin for 2 weeks wanted as much of the summer out of the infusion chairs as possible. when you have time send me a pm and i will let you know my name so i can see robin on facebook. i would appreciate it.
Posts.Title: Halaven - Day 1 PJB Wanderingneedle

Posts.Content: Jan 5, 2012 03:18AM penny4cats wrote: i am back to sleeping with a hat on or trying to anyways. the joke on me is i keep my feet stuck out as some of the xeloda must be still in me. any knittters who could make us funny sea urchin hats only kidding. penny
Posts.Title: Halaven - Day 1 PJB Wanderingneedle

Posts.Content: Jan 19, 2012 01:43PM penny4cats wrote: Hi, gladto know i may keep a little hair. i will start my cycle 3 next week with no premed. I was relieved cycle 2 was not as bad. I am settling into a life that my fulltime job is me. taking care of me as much as i can. hobbies who had time other than reading before am  but now i knit and am enjoying sewing class. I need a computer tutor so i can make snapfish books for my young adults. am i the only one running halaven peripherally no port? looking forward to the tee shirts karen. glad you are feeling better. penny weird but i have a good appetite on this drug xeloda i just didn't care towards the end of its' effectiveness.
Posts.Title: Halaven - Day 1 PJB Wanderingneedle

Posts.Content: Jan 26, 2012 03:44AM penny4cats wrote: Welcome alice and hidingfromit, i think i felt the head funny feeling after cycle 1 treatment 2. my head did not hurt as much this time but it is that weird feeling when the hair follicle dies. why not the mustache or armpits oh well. still have enough to do a female comb over lol. look like peter pan with mange. i went from xeloda to halaven with just a week in between. the fatigue was horrible cycle one. talk about naps. cycle 2 better and i'll see what cycle 3 brings. i wish i knew how much energy i would have for a day with a gauge before trying too much and running on fumes, a few times wondering how i would get myself home. my counts never go back to normal so i hate the feeling winded with exertion like stairs. let me know what protocol your onc is doing. i have had no nausea meds. no zofran headaches. alot of us get the weird day3/4 sort flu like. tired,spacey.
Posts.Title: Halaven - Day 1 PJB Wanderingneedle

Posts.Content: Aug 4, 2012 06:01AM penny4cats wrote: I have a fluffy seatbelt protector found easily at an auto parts supply store.
Posts.Title: Port Questions Lynn1 CelineFlower

Posts.Content: Jul 14, 2012 03:45PM penny4cats wrote: Thank you Caryn, Would I have the same problem with a new port? IR only does one brand of ports. Can you have anew port same place as the old one? Anyone know if 6 weeks is okay between flushing? I feel like old time movies and just want to take out my swiss army knife and carve the bugger out. probably not the best idea i've had but point for creativity for saving the ins co money. My care will probably top 500000 if i live another year or so counting original surgeries actually pay out after contracted rates still close to 300000 and yet they don't want to test dense breasts too many false positives. it's all about statistics and cost savings. another soap box of mine but i am not thinking about my clogged chest plumbing-miralax for ports
Posts.Title: Port Questions Lynn1 CelineFlower

Posts.Content: Jul 20, 2012 02:12PM penny4cats wrote: Sandy, sorry to hear all your s****ky news. with all that you have to handle, you don't need the darn port being a pia. i thought you just had to wait. interventional radiology does the homeopathic dose of tpa clot buster. i hope once and yours keeps working. i won't deal with the second clot busting until end of august when it is time for a scan and blood. my onc will give gemzar if the port works for in, even if no blood withdraw. but that means peripheral sticks which is why we got the port in the first place. cbc can be done with a fingerstick and they knead the fingertip to get the magic amt. it hurts but not bad compared to the several attempts up and down the arm. hugs and keep me posted. penny
Posts.Title: Port Questions Lynn1 CelineFlower

Posts.Content: Oct 12, 2012 05:52PM penny4cats wrote: Hope you had a great day and the grandkids and kids left a little of your cake for you to eat! Here's to a drink 4/2013 in Phillie!
Posts.Title: I made it to the big 50!!!! LuAnnH Annie62

Posts.Content: Jan 9, 2012 09:03AM penny4cats wrote: is the carafate liquid an otc or rx. what is it's active ingredient. thank you
Posts.Title: Getting the jump on stomatitis Chickadee MJLToday

Posts.Content: Jan 8, 2012 06:29PM penny4cats wrote: I use 1/4 tsp baking soda to 8 0z warm water. Extra soft bristles on toothbrush and biotene pbf toothpaste and rinse the green label because I have dry mouth from pain and other meds. Did the viscous oral 2% lidocaine swish no swallow last chemo cycle. Really thick to swish but very cheap unlike some of the compunded miracle mouthwashes. Also read a little sour cream prior to having to swallow helps in theory anyways. Wishing you easier swallowing. It just ***** to eat when it hurts. Penny
Posts.Title: Getting the jump on stomatitis Chickadee MJLToday

Posts.Content: Aug 28, 2012 06:48AM penny4cats wrote: LuAnn, I am just sending hugs and love your way. I was so glad to meet you. I am missing Marie/Reesie. I looked at our picture from Phil and she was the one who posted it. I have been living alone for almost a year now. I am alone but rarely lonely. There are lots of tears of sorrow at leaving my son and daughter someday. I am fortunate to have moved to  a wonderful community where I go the senior center to sew and have art, knitting, outdoor activities all sponsored by our local cancer organization. I appreciate that Frapp (Pat) and I are close enough to have lunch. I still have your number on my frig. so after 9:05 PM my verizon minutes are free. I think you have just pushed yourself to keep going for so long on autopilot, now you get to explore the backroads. Penny
Posts.Title: I am so lost in life now.... LuAnnH LuAnnH

Posts.Content: Sep 12, 2012 11:11PM penny4cats wrote: Sorry to hear of your increasing pain. If you are having a simple mx no lymph node dissection than i think recovery woulld be fairly straightforward other than the yucky drains. I hated radiation and the boost more than chemo but are you eligible for the radioactive seed thingy so its a much shorter course. My pain and palliative NP Maureen Lynch at DF is superb and I can not recommend her more highly, can you tell I am on mmore methadone while MGH figures out my compression fracture. If you opt for a mx or bmx ask for a Jackie jacket. My BWH surgeon was Katherine Carter and others swear ny Dirk Iglehart DF. I agree reduce the tumor burden but what do we know. If you go radiation get an rx for biafine we/re wound strenght. great stuff for after rads. goodnight and healing hugs.
Posts.Title: radiation or double mx-need input please Frapp Frapp

Posts.Content: Aug 4, 2012 09:17AM penny4cats wrote: Kohl's check out sales clerk to me "But how did you get it?" It being stage four/terminal BC" I wanted to reply at a Kohl's power hour sale or would you like to shake my hand and I can give it to you "cancer being such a gift"; but I restrained myself and replied "thru the lottery of life"
Posts.Title: Lets do a Sh*t People say to Metastatic BC Patients Fitztwins ChicagoGirl

Posts.Content: Nov 7, 2012 11:44AM penny4cats wrote: hugs, just got out of hospital after a week stay. 4 rads to go and meet with onc today to decide next tx. developed malignant ascites in hosp and had to have periocentesis, donated a few liters to science of formerly er pos now resistent to anti horm. hope to help other women. i consented back in 2004. research md very nice and appreciative. saw me on my strectcher the next day and stopped to thank me again. alot would have walked on by. off to df in the snow and wind. will see what IK has up his sleeve but am too tired to ask the questions I need to. i aam on fragmin once a day now.
Posts.Title: DVT and treatment, Blood transfusion temp increases. penny4cats Frapp

Posts.Content: penny4cats wrote: I just got dxed with compression fractureof L4 and question on L2 via CT scan. I am having a bone scan to go a hunting and then figure out if I need an MRI. My onc is a general one and has no one on Xgeva. My ins. carrier does not care and my port may still be f**up so I am lobbying for Xgeva as I can stay on AA a little longer due to inconclusive progression of abdominal mets. I always get the worst in side effect land so from what I have read Xgeva seems to have less. Any feedback would be great. Happy Labor Day Weekend to all (for us everyday can be a labor sometimes just to get out of bed others labors of love) I have to retire from ziplining and any type of active lifestyle. This disease so s***ks. Dx 12/1/2009, ILC, 5cm, Stage IV, Grade 1, 13/17 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Zometa vs. Xgeva penny4cats steelrose

Posts.Title: Lobular Blues rakulynda penny4cats

Posts.Content: Jul 28, 2012 11:43PM penny4cats wrote: thank you for the info, my left chest power port is headed for it's second port check next mo. it seems i form fibrin sheaths easily. don't know if arm port would be any better but agree mutliple sticks with needles in chest and then going peripherally was not in my play book. love the image of the vodoo doll, may actually make one for my next trip to cardiac cath.
Posts.Title: Getting a new port in my arm. Does anyone else have one there? Sido Sido

Posts.Content: penny4cats wrote: As Sandy was bearing down, I was spending 10 hours in a Boston ER. My blood transfusions went well until towards the end and my temp climbed. No beds so not admitted but kept me just seeing if the temp would drop after a dose of motrin. I had self diagnosed a DVT and was glad when the ultrasonographer confirmed. I am starting radiation to L1 to S2 tomorrow and trying to miss all my abdominal mets from lobular. I received luvenox and coumadin and was sent home with scripts. My Onc PA called this am and said don't take anymore coumadin because it interfers with so many chemos. I have to use my thighs for the luvenox because of radiation to back/stomach area.Does this mean luvenox the rest 0f my life and havingi/r, ptt all the time? This darn ca is totally interferring with my life. I hold all of you in Sandy's path in my heart. Dx 12/1/2009, ILC, 5cm, Stage IV, Grade 1, 13/17 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: DVT and treatment, Blood transfusion temp increases. penny4cats Frapp

Posts.Content: Dec 1, 2012 06:38PM penny4cats wrote: thank you for reaching out. i was buried by the avalanche. my latest wrinkle i lost alot of weight so can't go back on chemo yet. try gaining weight without dairy, nuts, fruit, veggies. i look at the rice, soy and almond milk and can't go there yet. letting maple syrup replace chocolate. eating ham and eggs every breakfast. drinking a ton of soda and if only i could find a bakery that made ginger people or butter cookies. butter seems ok. haven't opened the vegan sour cream or cream cheese. drinking coke and eating potato chips. soy yogurt not bad.  i was on antibiotics a fw weeks ago and then really sick after japanese food and then tried dairy even with the lactaid so await news on c diff just what i would need now. home pt  and ot pronounced me ready to face the world. i avoid my pain meds so i can drive. off to see a cardiologist next week and glad to be back in my therapists chair.
Posts.Title: DVT and treatment, Blood transfusion temp increases. penny4cats Frapp

Posts.Content: Dec 16, 2011 06:22AM penny4cats wrote: i had only 15 mg of decadron prior to my first halaven drip. my 19 yo daughter is home from college. i had a brief nap and then ate and was wide awake until 2am. how cruel to give us this brief glimpse of energy=.normalcy for me to only have taken away in such a short time. the next one i refer to as the crash and burn phase. i just learned to knit so am enjoying it almost as a meditation. not much concentration required- i keep it simple scarves-the onc said 10 mg  next time if the first went okay. i always used to joke we could have a great cleaning company togo out in the middle of the night. but with low counts we'd have to go full moon suits. aka the breaking bad look. take care Penny
Posts.Title: pigging out: decadron or apprehension K-Lo 3rings

Posts.Content: May 3, 2012 07:51PM penny4cats wrote: can't write more as still dealing with news of progression. bone,brain,liver mets are not any better but better understood..we lobular sisters wtih our peritoneal, colon, stomach etc..it is a hard road because pain, anti nausea meds mess wtih our gi tract..told to continue miralax to keep everything moving past narrowing, will continue benefiber for now...so looking forward to p and p my pants...talk about returning to...advanced cancer is like aging in fast forward..glad i still have my mind and may make a decision that it is my time to check out of the physical one at a to be determined time..hugs and healing to you all...ps does anyone hang out in the ovarian chat rooms because our issues are more like theirs except for most chemos..have you considered medical marij. LBBC meeting in phil a week ago said capsules only legal form in ma cause hallucinations more than the plant..so best to grow your own or know supplier and use vaporizer..i am definitely ready to try for low grade nausea and to improve appetite..have you tried sniffing ginger teabag to ease yucky stomach feeling. i hate having the stomache feeling most of the time now..but spring is here and the flowering trees are beautiful. thank you for listening and sharing
Posts.Title: Lobular Blues rakulynda penny4cats

Posts.Content: Jan 31, 2012 05:10PM penny4cats wrote: Janis, I still strongly about having a bc quilt like the aids quilt that signifies to the public how many sisters and brother we loose each year. I listened to Shirley Metz and she invoked the hiv/aids analogy. I feel it should have guidelines but not like others who want the ribbon represented for uniformity. Like those lost in the early years of hiv/aids the panels represent so much to the people who made them and those lost lives represented. We are so much more than our disease. We are in a war and we don't have a memorial, I only have to think of the children without mothers who bear witness to the collateral damage. During the pink haze month have the quilt on the nfl playing fields. If people gave the cost of one beer to fund metastatic only research maybe alot of children would have more time with their moms. penny
Posts.Title: Well January Sucked Fitztwins 3littlegirls

Posts.Content: Dec 27, 2011 08:36AM penny4cats wrote: Janis, We picked it as the movie to see on christmas day no less. my daughter kept saying mom areyou crying. are you okay. there were some okay parts about grief, mourning, moving on but yet remembering and honoring the mom. our childrens childhood were stolen from them by what they have had to witness. on a lighter note i remember the many laughs our group exchanged in coral gables and the story of your twins and the knife. Penny
